newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: "Significant" bomb-making find in Ireland.
newsitem.headline: "Significant" bomb-making find in Ireland.

text.p: Irish police have uncovered a significant amount of bomb-making equipment in a search near the town of Cavan, on the border with Northern Ireland.
Police said one man was arrested after the equipment was found in a search of premises near the border town but gave no further details.
The equipment was thought to have been gathered by an Irish repubican group fighting British rule of Northern Ireland.
The main group, the Irish Republican Army (IRA), called a truce on July 20 but at least two other organisations with the same goal say they will continue to attack British targets.
The IRA is thought to have several tonnes of arms hidden in the Irish republic including semtex plastic explosive and automatic weapons.

It has said it will never surrender its arsenal until a lasting political settlement is agreed at peace talks to which its political wing, Sinn Fein, will be invited in September if the guerrilla truce is deemed genuine by Britain.
